In some scenarios, access to the player instance itself might be restricted. In this case it's still possible to use a live non-timecoded Ease Live overlay, with some limitations to player integration (harder to tweak the UX). The main job of the player plugin in this scenario is to show/hide the controls so that it is possible to interact with the player. This has to be done with css only instead of relying on the player API.
